SENT.plain: This articles reviews the effects of smoking on the cardiovascular system

Smoking accelerates and aggravates atherosclerosis and increases the risk of coronary artery disease and its clinical manifestations (unstable angina, acute myocardial infarction and sudden death), cerebrovascular diseases, aortic aneurysms and peripheral artery occlusive diseases
Smoking is considered the most important modifiable risk factor for these diseases
Fortunately, quitting smoking reduces and even normalizes cardiovascular risk
